intro: Lesquerella ovalifolia, commonly known as the ovalleaf lesquerella, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces capsules that contain seeds rich in oil, which has been used in traditional medicine and industrial applications. Lesquerella ovalifolia typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and economic studies.
